channel.title: Email Spam Bot: By: Davidi2
channel.description:
This was approved by Taharok
[18:47] if you posted it on moparisthebest.org however [18:47] uhm [18:47] i dont think there's anything wrong with it
[b]What is this?[/b] This very simple HTML Form + PHP that spams the entered Email adress the desired amount. [b]Prove it![/b][url=http://www.davidscape.com/spam.html] Davidi2's SpamBot[/url] [b]I want the code![/b] I am not just going to post it right here, because I know the immature people will just use it to spam inappropriately. If you've seen it on my website and want the code just PM me here. -Subject: SpamBot- -Message: HTML & PHP- At staff: If it really is required that I post the code just tell me and I will.

item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:21, topic:308705”][quote author=inertia link=topic=405177.msg2998575#msg2998575 date=1255793994]
using a valid mail relay server and sent 1000 messages to a hotmail address, you’d get max 5 successful emails if you were lucky.
[/quote]lies. if theres a small delay in-between emails, all of them get sent[/quote]
They’re not stupid, their mail servers know when some tool is sending thousands of duplicate emails from the same address to the same address even if you do space them out a bit.

eczema3:

@inertia: I managed to flood myself with 11 thousand emails, so that comment was bullshit.

When was this, 1990?

item.title: Email Spam Bot: By: Davidi2
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

eczema3:

BRB spamming FBI

Dumb.

[quote=“inertia, post:17, topic:308705”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=405177.msg2998233#msg2998233 date=1255758768]
Can you tell us what the message would be?

Edit:

This doesn’t even work
[/quote]

Nope these scripts rarely work practically, even though everything is correct. For one, all the major email providers only accept mail from whitelisted IP addresses/ranges so you can’t send emails from home. They also block free hosts which enable mail access. Secondly, don’t you think the email providers have spam protection in place…? If you used this script using a valid mail relay server and sent 1000 messages to a hotmail address, you’d get max 5 successful emails if you were lucky.

This is also why it wouldn’t work without setting headers. They’ll just ignore your message completely if you’re using the basic PHP mail function.[/quote]
Ty for educated response. Would rep.

Read full topic

item.title: Email Spam Bot: By: Davidi2
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:13, topic:308705”]Can you tell us what the message would be?

Edit:

This doesn’t even work[/quote]

Nope these scripts rarely work practically, even though everything is correct. For one, all the major email providers only accept mail from whitelisted IP addresses/ranges so you can’t send emails from home. They also block free hosts which enable mail access. Secondly, don’t you think the email providers have spam protection in place…? If you used this script using a valid mail relay server and sent 1000 messages to a hotmail address, you’d get max 5 successful emails if you were lucky.

This is also why it wouldn’t work without setting headers. They’ll just ignore your message completely if you’re using the basic PHP mail function.

Read full topic

item.title: Email Spam Bot: By: Davidi2
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

  1. The mail function works perfectly, what he has there will work.
  2. The isset is to check if the form was submitted, if it was then all the $_POST fields would have data in them, therefore they would be ‘set’.

Read full topic

item.title: Email Spam Bot: By: Davidi2
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yea, that’s kinda what it looks like. Only differences are:

  1. I put the input in a different HTML document
  2. I set a maximum of 100 emails and a min of 1 email (just like an extra 6 lines of code)
  3. Yours wouldn’t work, because you don’t have the headers. (I tried it without headers, didn’t work for me :S)
  4. Why would you need the isset? I don’t have it.
  5. I have a log of each email to show if it passed or failed.

Like I said, I’m not trying to impress anybody with what a great PHP coder or anything. I thought this site was about learning, so I figured some people could learn something from this. I don’t even see a reason to post in this topic if you already know how to do it.

Read full topic
